section.title: Application
section.para: The application server is configured using a standard java properties file. This same format is used in different ways for either an actual deployment or a development environment.
A typical java properties file has the following general form;
There are a number of keys which are described below.

section.title: architecture.default.code
section.para: This configuration setting defines the code of the default architecture that should be shown. Example values might be "x86_gcc2" or "ppc".

section.title: deployment.isproduction
section.para: This configuration setting can have a value of "true" or "false". When false, the system will display a warning message on the user interface to indicate that the deployment is non-production.

section.title: pkgversion.viewcounter.protectrecurringincrementfromsameclient
section.para: This configuration setting can have a value of "true" or "false". When true (the default), the system will make basic efforts to protect against one client repeatedly incrementing a package version's view counter. This might happen when a user navigates to view a package and then navigates away and back again. With this value set as true, within a window of time, these two visits would be considered to be the same in terms of incrementing the view counter.

section.title: hvif2png.path
section.para: This is a system path to the hvif2png tool. This tool is used to render HVIF icon data to PNG images that can be displayed on the web site. This value is optional, but if absent, no icons for packages will shown. Instead, placebo icons will be displayed.

section.title: optipng.path
section.para: This is a system path to the OptiPNG tool. This tool can be used in some situations to optimize PNG data; for example when configuring icons for packages. An example value might be "/usr/local/bin/optipng".

section.title: desktop.application.version.min
section.para: This optional value can be configured to specify a minimum version value for the HaikuDepot desktop application. If a version of the desktop application attempts to communicate with the server with a version lower than this value then the server will return a 412 (precondition failed) HTTP status and a header that describes the minimum version required.

section.title: Package Rating Derivation
section.para: See the user rating chapter for further details on how the package rating derivation algorithm uses these values to calculate packages' ratings.

section.title: userrating.aggregation.pkg.versionsback
section.para: This value is the number of versions back in the past from which the derivation will consider user ratings. This value defaults to 2.

section.title: userrating.aggregation.pkg.minratings
section.para: When deriving an aggregate rating for a package, if there are not enough user ratings then the package will have no rating. This value is the minimum threshold and has a default value of 3.

section.title: jdbc.driver
section.para: This is the class name of the JDBC driver employed. The value should be "org.postgresql.Driver"

section.title: jdbc.url
section.para: This is the JDBC connect URL to the main database. The value should be of the form "jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/haikudepotserver"

section.title: jdbc.username
section.para: This is the database username.

section.title: jdbc.password
section.para: This is the database password.

section.title: flyway.migrate
section.para: Set this to "true" if you would like database schema migrations to be applied automatically as necessary. Generally this should be configured to "true".

section.title: flyway.validateOnMigrate
section.para: Set this to "false" if you want the system to validate schema migrations. This can be helpful at development time when the schema is in flux, but should be "true" in production.

section.title: flyway.validateOnMigrate
section.para: Set this to "false" if you want the system to validate schema migrations. This can be helpful at development time when the schema is in flux, but should be "true" in production.

section.title: cayenne.query.cache.size
section.para: Cayenne is the ORM system behind this application. Some queries' results are cached and this configuration item allows the size of the query cache to be configured.

section.title: jawr.debug.on
section.para: This configuration relates to the JAWR debug setting. It will default to "false".

section.title: baseurl
section.para: This is the base URL used to formulate URLs to be sent out that can be used to return back to the system.

For example; this might be used to create the URL used to manage the password reset process. The URL base is included in the email body to users who have requested a password-reset. This has to be configured because the application itself does not know the path by which the HTTP request had reached it.
In the case of a development environment, this base URL might be something like "http://localhost:8080"
Note that this value should have no trailing slash.

section.title: Token Bearer Authentication
section.para: You can find out more about the token-bearer authentication system here.

section.title: authentication.jws.sharedkey
section.para: This shared key is used to sign the authentication tokens transmitted between the server and the client. This value is optional. If it is not supplied then a random shared key will be used for each launch of the application server. Non-configured keys will not work where two or more load-balanced application servers are employed. Any random value can be used for this and a possible way to create values is to use the command "uuidgen".

section.title: authentication.jws.issuer
section.para: This identifies the system that has produced a given token and is required. It should be a string with the suffix ".hds". For example "staging.hds".

section.title: authentication.jws.expiryseconds
section.para: This configuration value defines how many seconds a token will be able to be used before it expires. This value is optional and a sensible default will be employed in its absence.

section.title: Email
section.para: You can find out more about the email system here.

section.title: smtp.host
section.para: The host name or IP address of the SMTP server. This configuration value is required.

section.title: smtp.port
section.para: The port of the SMTP server. This configuration value is optional and will default to 25.

section.title: smtp.auth
section.para: Possible values are "true" or "false". When true, SMTP authentication will be used. This configuration value is optional and will default to "false".

section.title: smtp.username
section.para: This is only required when SMTP authentication is configured.

section.title: smtp.password
section.para: This is only required when SMTP authentication is configured.

section.title: smtp.starttls
section.para: Possible values are "true" and "false". Configures the SMTP transport. This value is optional and defaults to "false".

section.title: email.from
section.para: This is the email address from which emails outbound from the system will be sent. Typically this might be a "no-reply" email address such as "noreply@haiku-os.org".

section.title: Logging
section.para: The application logging uses the SLF4J logging framework. This is backed by the Logback logging system. When formatting log lines, it is possible to add additional meta data from the application server. This is known as the "MDC". Presently supported;
